result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Must follow through with probation and rules of supervision. 
- Must report to probation today (6/10/2022).

miscConds.notes:
- $200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts. 
- $100.00 Domestic Abuse surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment.

- $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

- Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.
- Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.
- Must complete domestic violence assessment and follow through.
- May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

records.addlTxt: Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea (Count 1)
DNA Acknowledgment Form
Not to have abusive contact with: T.A.A. or D.J.H. No contact with K.M.C. Not to possess or consume alcohol. Absolute Sobriety. Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.

Prosecuting attorney Holly Wood Webster in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ervin Clarence Schake in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Ervin Clarence Schake. 10:36 a.m. AO-Clerk. Parties have an agreement.  Victims rights complied with.  24 month DAGP on Count 1. Bond modified to signature.

Count 1 - De plea G. Ct finds plea made FVK&I. Ct does not accept plea at this time. 

Count 2 - De plea G. Ct finds plea made FVK&I. Ct accepts plea, adj. guilty, judgment entered.

Count 3 - DRI w/ prejudice w/out costs.

SENTENCE 

May not possess a firearm, $100 domestic abuse surcharge, $10 fine plus costs totaling $265.60, DNA sample & $200 surcharge, w/h sentence, up to 1 year probation, AODA & follow through, domestic violence assessment & follow through, follow through with probation and rules of probation, must report to probation today. 2 days credit. PCR. 11:00 a.m. adj.
